newsitem.title: USA: Hilton Hotels buys Anchorage Hilton.
newsitem.headline: Hilton Hotels buys Anchorage Hilton.

text.p: Hilton Hotels Corp. said Thursday it bought the Anchorage Hilton Hotel in Anchorage, Alaska, for $67 million, and sold its stake in the Conrad International Hong Kong for about $112 million.
The company said the price for the Anchorage Hilton equals about $113,000 per room, and the sale of the stake in the Hong Kong property works out to about $730,000 per room.

The total price for the Hong Kong stake, which Hilton sold to Sino Land Co. Ltd., included $93 million in cash plus the assumption of $12 million in debt. Sino also made a payment for certain waivers to bring the total value to about $112 million.
Sino now owns 80 percent of the equity in the 513-room Hong Kong hotel.
Hilton said it plans to invest $3 million to renovate certain parts of the 591-room Anchorage Hilton, which it purchased from Bristol Corp.
Hilton's stock edged down 62.5 cents to $26.125 on the New York Stock Exchange in early afternoon trading.
